title: Git Basics - Friendly Guide
summary: Plain-language primer for daily Git: clone, branch, stage/commit, push/pull, and read the log.
mentalModel: Git is snapshots plus pointers: commits are snapshots, branches are movable pointers, remotes are shared pointers. Keep history small and clear.

sections.title: Setup and identity
content: Set your global name/email once: git config --global user.name / user.email.
Use SSH or HTTPS consistently to avoid auth popups.
Clone with git clone <url> [folder] to get history plus working tree.

sections.title: Daily loop
content: Check status (git status -sb) to see staged/unstaged/untracked files.
Stage intentionally (git add <path>), then commit with a clear message.
Pull with rebase (git pull --rebase origin main) before pushing to avoid noisy merge commits.

sections.title: Reading history
content: git log --oneline --graph --decorate --all shows branches and tags at a glance.
git show <commit> to see details; git diff to inspect working changes.
Tag releases with git tag -a vX.Y.Z -m "msg" for traceability.

commonWorkflows.name: Start a feature cleanly
steps: Build, test, then git add + git commit
tips: Branch from main to minimize conflicts.
Use -u on first push so future pushes are shorter.

commonWorkflows.name: Keep your fork current
tips: Rebase keeps history linear for easier review.
Run tests after rebasing to catch integration issues early.

memoryHooks: Status first, add second, commit third.
Rebase to stay linear; merge only when needed.
Tags mark releases; branches mark work in progress.

examples.title: Fix a small typo
commands: git commit -m "Fix typo in setup instructions"
examples.explanation: Even tiny changes deserve a focused commit for clean history.

examples.title: Inspect recent work
examples.explanation: Combine graph, show, and diff to understand context quickly.

troubleshooting: Wrong author: update global config and amend the last commit if needed.
Rejected push: pull --rebase origin main, resolve conflicts, push again.
Detached HEAD confusion: git switch <branch> to get back to a branch pointer.
recap: Clone, branch from main, commit small, rebase before push.
Tags for releases, branches for work, commits for units of change.
